## Packages
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
```


## Data
Load data.
```{r}
data <- read.csv('U:/Data Science/DS241_bikes_2021/data.csv')

data <- subset(covid, select = c(state, tot_cases, new_case, tot_death, new_death, created_at, submission_date))

covid <- data %>%
  filter(state =='DC') %>%
  group_by(submission_date) %>%
  arrange(submission_date, decreasing=TRUE) %>%
  ungroup()

#
# separate(covid$created_at, into = c("Date", "Time"), sep = " ", remove = TRUE, extra='drop')

```

## Visualization
```{r visualise, warning=FALSE}
ggplot(data = covid,
       mapping = aes(x = submission_date, 
                     y = tot_death, )) +
  # represent cumulative cases with lines
  geom_line(size = 0.7, alpha = 0.8) +
  # turn off legend
  guides(color = FALSE) +
  # use pretty colors
  scale_color_viridis_d() +
  # use minimal theme
  theme_minimal() +
  # customize labels
  labs(
    x = "Date",
    y = "Deaths",
    title = "Cumulative deaths from COVID-19 in DC"
  )

```
